trans-unit.source: By using a wizard in Visual Studio, you can generate push notifications from a mobile service that was created with Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: By using a wizard in Visual Studio, you can generate push notifications from a mobile service that was created with Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Code generated by the push notification wizard
trans-unit.target: Code generated by the push notification wizard

trans-unit.source: Code generated by the push notification wizard
trans-unit.target: Code generated by the push notification wizard

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: By using a wizard in Visual Studio, you can generate push notifications from a mobile service that was created with Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: By using a wizard in Visual Studio, you can generate push notifications from a mobile service that was created with Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: The Visual Studio wizard generates code to help you get started.
trans-unit.target: The Visual Studio wizard generates code to help you get started.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how the wizard modifies your project, what the generated code does, how to use this code, and what you can do next to get the most out of push notifications.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how the wizard modifies your project, what the generated code does, how to use this code, and what you can do next to get the most out of push notifications.

trans-unit.source: See [Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview](tiles-and-notifications-windows-push-notification-services--wns--overview.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview](tiles-and-notifications-windows-push-notification-services--wns--overview.md).

trans-unit.source: How the wizard modifies your project
trans-unit.target: How the wizard modifies your project

trans-unit.source: The push notification wizard modifies your project in the following ways:
trans-unit.target: The push notification wizard modifies your project in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: Adds a reference to Mobile Services Managed Client (MobileServicesManagedClient.dll).
trans-unit.target: Adds a reference to Mobile Services Managed Client (MobileServicesManagedClient.dll).

trans-unit.source: Not applicable to JavaScript projects.
trans-unit.target: Not applicable to JavaScript projects.

trans-unit.source: Adds a file in a subfolder under services, and names the file push.register.cs, push.register.vb, push.register.cpp, or push.register.js.
trans-unit.target: Adds a file in a subfolder under services, and names the file push.register.cs, push.register.vb, push.register.cpp, or push.register.js.

trans-unit.source: Creates a channels table on the database server for the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Creates a channels table on the database server for the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: The table contains information that's required to send push notifications to app instances.
trans-unit.target: The table contains information that's required to send push notifications to app instances.

trans-unit.source: Creates scripts for four functions: delete, insert, read and update.
trans-unit.target: Creates scripts for four functions: delete, insert, read and update.

trans-unit.source: Creates a script with a custom API, notifyallusers.js, which sends a push notification to all clients.
trans-unit.target: Creates a script with a custom API, notifyallusers.js, which sends a push notification to all clients.

trans-unit.source: Adds a declaration to your App.xaml.cs, App.xaml.vb, or App.xaml.cpp file, or adds a declaration to a new file, service.js, for JavaScript projects.
trans-unit.target: Adds a declaration to your App.xaml.cs, App.xaml.vb, or App.xaml.cpp file, or adds a declaration to a new file, service.js, for JavaScript projects.

trans-unit.source: The declaration declares a MobileServiceClient object, which contains the information that's required to connect to the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: The declaration declares a MobileServiceClient object, which contains the information that's required to connect to the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: You can access this MobileServiceClient object, which is named *MyServiceName*Client, from any page in your app by using the name App.*MyServiceName*Client.
trans-unit.target: You can access this MobileServiceClient object, which is named *MyServiceName*Client, from any page in your app by using the name App.*MyServiceName*Client.

trans-unit.source: The services.js file contains the following code:
trans-unit.target: The services.js file contains the following code:

trans-unit.source: Registration for push notifications
trans-unit.target: Registration for push notifications

trans-unit.source: In push.register.\*, the UploadChannel method registers the device to receive push notifications.
trans-unit.target: In push.register.\*, the UploadChannel method registers the device to receive push notifications.

trans-unit.source: The Store tracks installed instances of your app and provides the push notification channel.
trans-unit.target: The Store tracks installed instances of your app and provides the push notification channel.

trans-unit.source: See [**PushNotificationChannelManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241284).
trans-unit.target: See [**PushNotificationChannelManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241284).

trans-unit.source: The client code is similar for both the JavaScript backend and the .NET backend.
trans-unit.target: The client code is similar for both the JavaScript backend and the .NET backend.

trans-unit.source: By default, when you add push notifications for a JavaScript backend service, a sample call to notifyAllUsers custom API is inserted into the UploadChannel method.
trans-unit.target: By default, when you add push notifications for a JavaScript backend service, a sample call to notifyAllUsers custom API is inserted into the UploadChannel method.

trans-unit.source: Push notification tags provide a way to restrict notifications to a subset of clients.
trans-unit.target: Push notification tags provide a way to restrict notifications to a subset of clients.

trans-unit.source: You can use the for the registerNative method (or RegisterNativeAsync) method to either register for all push notifications without specifying tags, or you can register with tags by providing the second argument, an array of tags.
trans-unit.target: You can use the for the registerNative method (or RegisterNativeAsync) method to either register for all push notifications without specifying tags, or you can register with tags by providing the second argument, an array of tags.

trans-unit.source: If you register with one or more tags, you only receive notifications that match those tags.
trans-unit.target: If you register with one or more tags, you only receive notifications that match those tags.

trans-unit.source: Server-side scripts (JavaScript backend only)
trans-unit.target: Server-side scripts (JavaScript backend only)

trans-unit.source: For mobile services that use the JavaScript backend, the server-side scripts run when delete, insert, read, or update operations occur.
trans-unit.target: For mobile services that use the JavaScript backend, the server-side scripts run when delete, insert, read, or update operations occur.

trans-unit.source: The scripts don't implement these operations, but they run when a call from the client to the Windows Mobile REST API triggers these events.
trans-unit.target: The scripts don't implement these operations, but they run when a call from the client to the Windows Mobile REST API triggers these events.

trans-unit.source: The scripts then pass control onto the operations themselves by calling request.execute or request.respond to issue a response to the calling context.
trans-unit.target: The scripts then pass control onto the operations themselves by calling request.execute or request.respond to issue a response to the calling context.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Mobile Services REST API Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=511139).
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Mobile Services REST API Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=511139).

trans-unit.source: A variety of functions are available in the server-side script.
trans-unit.target: A variety of functions are available in the server-side script.

trans-unit.source: See [Register table operations in Azure Mobile Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=511140).
trans-unit.target: See [Register table operations in Azure Mobile Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=511140).

trans-unit.source: For a reference to all available functions, see [Mobile Services server script reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=257676).
trans-unit.target: For a reference to all available functions, see [Mobile Services server script reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=257676).

trans-unit.source: The following custom API code in Notifyallusers.js is also created:
trans-unit.target: The following custom API code in Notifyallusers.js is also created:

trans-unit.source: The sendNotifications function sends a single notification as a toast notification.
trans-unit.target: The sendNotifications function sends a single notification as a toast notification.

trans-unit.source: You can also use other types of push notifications.
trans-unit.target: You can also use other types of push notifications.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** For information about how to get help while editing scripts, see [Enabling IntelliSense for server-side JavaScript](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=309275).
trans-unit.target: **Tip** For information about how to get help while editing scripts, see [Enabling IntelliSense for server-side JavaScript](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=309275).

trans-unit.source: Push notification types
trans-unit.target: Push notification types

trans-unit.source: Windows supports notifications that aren't push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Windows supports notifications that aren't push notifications.

trans-unit.source: For general information about notifications, see [Delivering scheduled, periodic, and push notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh761484).
trans-unit.target: For general information about notifications, see [Delivering scheduled, periodic, and push notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh761484).

trans-unit.source: Toast notifications are easy to use, and you can review an example in the Insert.js code on the channel's table that's generated for you.
trans-unit.target: Toast notifications are easy to use, and you can review an example in the Insert.js code on the channel's table that's generated for you.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to use tile or badge notifications, you must create an XML template for the tile and badge, and you must specify the encoding of packaged information in the template.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to use tile or badge notifications, you must create an XML template for the tile and badge, and you must specify the encoding of packaged information in the template.

trans-unit.source: See [Working with tiles, badges, and toast notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868259).
trans-unit.target: See [Working with tiles, badges, and toast notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868259).

trans-unit.source: Because Windows responds to push notifications, it can handle most of these notifications when the app isn't running.
trans-unit.target: Because Windows responds to push notifications, it can handle most of these notifications when the app isn't running.

trans-unit.source: For example, a push notification could let a user know when a new mail message is available even when the local mail app isn't running.
trans-unit.target: For example, a push notification could let a user know when a new mail message is available even when the local mail app isn't running.

trans-unit.source: Windows handles a toast notification by displaying a message, such as the first line of a text message.
trans-unit.target: Windows handles a toast notification by displaying a message, such as the first line of a text message.

trans-unit.source: Windows handles a tile or badge notification by updating an app's live tile to reflect the number of new mail messages.
trans-unit.target: Windows handles a tile or badge notification by updating an app's live tile to reflect the number of new mail messages.

trans-unit.source: In this way, you can prompt users of your app to check it for new information.
trans-unit.target: In this way, you can prompt users of your app to check it for new information.

trans-unit.source: Your app can receive raw notifications when it's running, and you can use them to send data to your app.
trans-unit.target: Your app can receive raw notifications when it's running, and you can use them to send data to your app.

trans-unit.source: If your app isn't running, you can set up a background task to monitor push notifications.
trans-unit.target: If your app isn't running, you can set up a background task to monitor push notifications.

trans-unit.source: You should use push notifications according to the guidelines for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, because those notifications use up a user's resources and can be distracting if overused.
trans-unit.target: You should use push notifications according to the guidelines for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, because those notifications use up a user's resources and can be distracting if overused.

trans-unit.source: See [Guidelines and checklist for push notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh761462).
trans-unit.target: See [Guidelines and checklist for push notifications](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh761462).

trans-unit.source: If you're updating live tiles with push notifications, you should also follow the guidelines in [Guidelines and checklist for tiles and badges](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465403).
trans-unit.target: If you're updating live tiles with push notifications, you should also follow the guidelines in [Guidelines and checklist for tiles and badges](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465403).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Using the Windows Push Notification Services (WNS)
trans-unit.target: Using the Windows Push Notification Services (WNS)

trans-unit.source: You can call Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) directly if Mobile Services doesn't provide enough flexibility, if you want to write your server code in C# or Visual Basic, or if you already have a cloud service and you want to send push notifications from it.
trans-unit.target: You can call Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) directly if Mobile Services doesn't provide enough flexibility, if you want to write your server code in C# or Visual Basic, or if you already have a cloud service and you want to send push notifications from it.

trans-unit.source: By calling WNS directly, you can send push notifications from your own cloud service, such as a worker role that monitors data from a database or another web service.
trans-unit.target: By calling WNS directly, you can send push notifications from your own cloud service, such as a worker role that monitors data from a database or another web service.

trans-unit.source: Your cloud service must authenticate with WNS to send push notifications to your apps.
trans-unit.target: Your cloud service must authenticate with WNS to send push notifications to your apps.

trans-unit.source: See [How to authenticate with the Windows Push Notification Service (JavaScript)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465407) or [(C#/C++/VB)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868206).
trans-unit.target: See [How to authenticate with the Windows Push Notification Service (JavaScript)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465407) or [(C#/C++/VB)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868206).

trans-unit.source: You can also send push notifications by running a scheduled task in your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: You can also send push notifications by running a scheduled task in your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: See [Schedule recurring jobs in Mobile Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=301694).
trans-unit.target: See [Schedule recurring jobs in Mobile Services](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=301694).

trans-unit.source: **Warning** Once you've run the push notification wizard once, don't run the wizard a second time to add registration code for another mobile service.
trans-unit.target: **Warning** Once you've run the push notification wizard once, don't run the wizard a second time to add registration code for another mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Running the wizard more than once per project generates code that results in overlapping calls to the [**CreatePushNotificationChannelForApplicationAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241287) method, which leads to a runtime exception.
trans-unit.target: Running the wizard more than once per project generates code that results in overlapping calls to the [**CreatePushNotificationChannelForApplicationAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241287) method, which leads to a runtime exception.

trans-unit.source: If you want to register for push notifications for more than one mobile service, run the wizard once and then rewrite the registration code to ensure that calls to **CreatePushNotificationChannelForApplicationAsync** do not run at the same time.
trans-unit.target: If you want to register for push notifications for more than one mobile service, run the wizard once and then rewrite the registration code to ensure that calls to **CreatePushNotificationChannelForApplicationAsync** do not run at the same time.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can accomplish this by moving the wizard-generated code in push.register.\* (including the call to **CreatePushNotificationChannelForApplicationAsync**) outside of the OnLaunched event, but the specifics of this will depend on your app's architecture.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can accomplish this by moving the wizard-generated code in push.register.\* (including the call to **CreatePushNotificationChannelForApplicationAsync**) outside of the OnLaunched event, but the specifics of this will depend on your app's architecture.
